Name: Mendes Stela of Ptolemy the Second
Description: The main scene of the Mendes commemorative stela of King Ptolemy the Second shows the royal family presenting their offerings to several deities. The king is joined by Queen Arsinoe the Second and Crown Prince Ptolemy. On the right side, the ram of Mendes stands elevated, surrounded by the deities and facing the royal family. The god Harpocrates and goddess Hat-Mehit, represented as a woman with a fish emblem on her head, are shown on a lower level along with the deified Queen Arsinoe the Second. The text celebrates the king's visit to the district of Mendes.
